intro: Meliosma poilanei, commonly known as the Madagascar mallow, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, pale pink to white flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
